newsitem.title: INDIA: India Essar to raise refinery capacity.
newsitem.headline: India Essar to raise refinery capacity.

text.p: India's Essar Oil Ltd said on Saturday it planned to raise the capacity of its proposed refinery to 10.5 million tonnes of crude a year from 9.0 million tonnes.
The cost of the refinery would go up to 58.15 billion rupees from the earlier estimate of 53.50 billion rupees, a company official told Reuters on Saturday.
She gave the following reasons for the increased cost:
* The rupee had depreciated to 35.90 against the dollar from 31.50 when the cost was earlier calculated
* Essar Oil is adding a hydro desulphurisation unit as per new government guidelines on sulphur content in diesel
* "A delayed coker is included in the configuration to improve the gross refining margin by $0.30 per barrel," the official said.
She said the currrent gross refining margin was $5.8 per barrel.

Essar Oil plans to create a separate joint venture firm to build infrastructure facilities such as single buoy mooring for the receipt of crude oil, jetty and rail/road despatch stations for product shipments, storage tanks and pipelines, she said.
"Discussions with potential joint venture partners are in an advanced stage," she said.
The refinery is expected to be commissioned by April 1999.
"About half of the civil works for crude and vacuum distillation units has been completed," she said.

Over 4,000 workers are working on the site on the western Gujarat coast, supervised by 30 expatriates from ABB Lummus besides 300 engineers from the state-run Engineers India Ltd, Tata Consultancy Engineers and Essar Group engineers, she said.
